posts.post_content:
@Entropic\_Acolyte: Either Wizards thought that Rise of the Eldrazi counted as an enchantment block (you know, with all of those Totem Armor auras going about), or else they took a look through the countless comments from players complaining about getting 2 for 1'ed when they cast auras on their creatures only to find it getting killed by removal shortly after, and then decided that players in general complain a lot about auras, and that they therefore should hold back on printing new ones since nobody likes them anyways.  
  
I for once love Arcanum Wings a lot. The artwork is beautiful, the flavor text is good, and the card is amazing. Somebody should really try and make a deck with this, Eldrazi Con\*\*\*ion and Academy Researchers. I'm sure that it's gonna be epic, dropping 12/12 Academy Researchers with Annihilator 2 and Trample on turn 3 on a regular basis.

Posted By: http404error (3/24/2012 6:04:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is great for all kinds of crazy tricks. Basically they all fall into 1 of 3 categories:  
1)Swing with the enchanted creature (which has evasion of course) then swap for an aura that pumps or triggers off of combat damage. ex. [Celestial Mantle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Celestial Mantle), [Mark of Sakiko](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mark of Sakiko), [Mythic Proportions](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mythic Proportions).  
2)Save mana when casting expensive auras like [Yavimaya's Embrace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yavimaya's Embrace) or [Eldrazi Con\*\*\*ion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eldrazi Con***ion) at instant speed.  
3)Wait until the enchanted creature is about to take damage or becomes the target of a spell and then swap out for an aura that makes it immune. ex. [Diplomatic Immunity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diplomatic Immunity), [Flickering Ward](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flickering Ward), [Spirit Mantle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spirit Mantle).
posts.html:
This is great for all kinds of crazy tricks. Basically they all fall into 1 of 3 categories:
1)Swing with the enchanted creature (which has evasion of course) then swap for an aura that pumps or triggers off of combat damage. ex. Celestial Mantle, Mark of Sakiko, Mythic Proportions.
2)Save mana when casting expensive auras like Yavimaya's Embrace or Eldrazi Con***ion at instant speed.
3)Wait until the enchanted creature is about to take damage or becomes the target of a spell and then swap out for an aura that makes it immune. ex. Diplomatic Immunity, Flickering Ward, Spirit Mantle.

Posted By: TPmanW (12/22/2011 9:25:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Vedalken\_Arbiter: "Rather than an Aura block, an Enchantment block seems more likely. After all they do Artifact block, multicolor blocks and tribal blocks." Are you being facetious? Mirrodin = artifact block, Ravnica & Shards of Alara = multicolor blocks, Lorwyn = tribal block.  
  
Technically we've already had an enchantment block, it just isn't known very well apparently. The actual "Enchantment Set" was in fact Urza's Saga block, which gave us cards like [Rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rancor) and [Argothian Enchantress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Argothian Enchantress). Also, Wizards in know way thinks the few Totem armors in Rise of the Eldrazi make it count as an Enchantment Deck; the auras just needed to be stronger to match the power of the Eldrazi, fully leveled level-up guys, and rebound spells. Still, an Enchantment Set where R&D makes it clear that that's what they're actually doing could possibly be in our future, up there with a return to Ravnica and a Wedge block.
posts.html:
@Vedalken_Arbiter: "Rather than an Aura block, an Enchantment block seems more likely. After all they do Artifact block, multicolor blocks and tribal blocks." Are you being facetious? Mirrodin = artifact block, Ravnica & Shards of Alara = multicolor blocks, Lorwyn = tribal block.

Technically we've already had an enchantment block, it just isn't known very well apparently. The actual "Enchantment Set" was in fact Urza's Saga block, which gave us cards like Rancor and Argothian Enchantress. Also, Wizards in know way thinks the few Totem armors in Rise of the Eldrazi make it count as an Enchantment Deck; the auras just needed to be stronger to match the power of the Eldrazi, fully leveled level-up guys, and rebound spells. Still, an Enchantment Set where R&D makes it clear that that's what they're actually doing could possibly be in our future, up there with a return to Ravnica and a Wedge block.
